medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing skin tightness, joint pain, and swelling of the hands and feet.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 2 years prior, when anemia was noted. Symptoms of swelling and pain in the hands started two months before the presentation, followed by pedal edema, skin tightening, and diffuse hyperpigmentation. Maintenance therapy with lenalidomide began but was stopped due to worsening symptoms. Joint pain intensified as well.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Multiple myeloma diagnosed 2 years ago; history of anemia, low-back pain, hyperlipidemia, hypertension, gastroesophageal reflux disease, prostate cancer (radical prostatectomy 11 years earlier).
medical_history.family_history: Mother and maternal uncle had rheumatoid arthritis.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with wife, works in an office, stopped smoking 20 years ago, drinks alcohol in moderation, does not use illicit drugs.
